answers.answer: How far along are you, is this your first pregnancy, etc etc. There can be many reasons why you might not feel frequent fetal movement, but with what you've provided it can be difficult to say much.

I agree, could be several reasons, but it's probably a good idea to call and tell your doctor about it. Maybe your baby has turned and is now facing your back (anterior positions), which makes it harder to feel the kicks. But either way, I would call your doctor...just to be on the safe side. Best of luck with everything!

I agree with the others.  How far along are you?  Do you know if you have an anterior or posterior placenta?  In any event, whenever concerned about fetal movement, it is best to see your Dr. or go to L&D.  I agree with Heather that it is far better to be safe.  Take care and good luck to you.

I also agree with the others and have the same questions.  And I say that, if you're truly worried about it, go into labor and delivery and have them monitor you and the baby.  I"ve had to go into L&D many times to have my blood pressure monitored (I have preeclampsia) and every time I go in, they say, "If you don't feel the baby move as often as usual, come right back in immediately."  Good luck!

question: Haven't felt movement as often. Used to be everyday. Now its like once a week. Why?
title: Movement
